title: Small Green Computer Announces Launch of microJukebox a new Device That Allows Users to Stream Their Entire CD Collection
text:
Many people value their CD collections, but still end up scratching CDs, losing them or otherwise not having access to them due to their inconvenient nature. Fortunately, Small Green Computer, recently announced the launch of their solution to this problem – the microJukebox . This new device allow users to stream their whole CD collection while it keeps their CDs protected from damage.
October 2, 2015
What if there were a way to not only keep a CD collection safe and sound, but to also make it much easier to access them and listen to CDs whenever the desire shows itself? That's exactly what the innovators at Small Green Computer are offering, with their recent launch announcement of the microJukebox , a stunning new device that allows a CD collection to be streamed, stored and protected, along with a long list of other features and benefits. The device will debut at the Rocky Mountain Audio Fest Oct 2nd-4th, 2015. Shoppers have responded to the news with enthusiasm.
“We're happy to say microJukebox is simple to set up and easy to use.”commented Andrew Gillis CEO of Small Green Computer. “There's no learning curve. Just plug in and start reconnecting with your CD Music collection.”
According to the company, in addition to streaming and safe storage of CDs, some other highlights of the microJukebox's features include: lossless CD ripping; the ability to control the device through iOS, Android with an intuitive touch control; instant availability on your Sonos system; and absolute simplicity, where there's no complex controls to figure out or remember.
Early users have given microJukebox very favorable reviews.
David D., from Boston, recently said in a five star review, “I thought my CD collection was being retired, but not any longer. With the microJukebox my CDs have come back to life and I couldn't be happier. I'm planning on buying two more for Christmas gifts. Fully recommended.”
For more information be sure to visit microjukebox.com .
